meanings.definition: A landlord who owns and profits from substandard, often dilapidated rental properties.
meanings.sent1: The slumlord refused to make any repairs to the broken windows in the apartment building.
meanings.sent2: The city council fined the slumlord for neglecting the safety of his tenants.
meanings.sent3: The slumlord's buildings were so run-down that even the rats complained about the conditions.
meanings.sent4: Living in one of the slumlord's properties felt like being trapped in a nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The slumlord's greed turned once vibrant neighborhoods into desolate wastelands.

meanings.definition: A person who owns and rents out low-quality, poorly maintained housing.
meanings.sent1: The slumlord charged high rent for the shabby apartments he owned.
meanings.sent2: Neighbors complained about the noise coming from the rowdy tenants of the slumlord.
meanings.sent3: The slumlord's properties were so bad, even the cockroaches considered moving out.
meanings.sent4: Living in one of the slumlord's buildings was like being stuck in a never-ending nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The slumlord's neglect turned once cozy homes into decrepit shells of their former selves.
